Responsibilities: Set up product documentation to onboard future team members.
Developed a full-stack application (AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, S3, ECS, SQS, CloudFormation) for copyright infringement checks.
Completed internal courses for AutoGluon and Foundational ML.

Experience.Company: Somaiya Vidyavihar, IN & Children’s Investment Fund Foundation (CIFF), U.K.
Responsibilities: Led a team of six to research the impact of technology on Online Child Sexual Abuse (OCSA) and Exploitation (OCSE).
Developed a tool to automate search and filter instances of OCSA and OCSE in legal cases.

Projects.Title: Automating LLM-Assisted Tuning for LSM-KVS
Projects.Description: Developed a framework that automates predicting workloads and setting tuning parameters for LSM-KVS using Modern LLMs.

Projects.Title: Leveraging Programmable Network Switch for pre-emptive LSM-KVS Operations
Projects.Description: Developed a controller to enhance LSM-KVS performance using programmable network switches (P4 Switches) for operations and online configuration modifications.

Projects.Title: An Exploration of High Throughput Timeseries Databases for Cutting-Edge Devices
Projects.Description: Exploring the integration of ZNS devices for timeseries databases like InfluxDB.

Projects.Title: Integrating Encryption into LSM-KVS in Monolith and Disaggregated Infrastructure
Projects.Description: Designed and developed a scalable and decentralized encryption design for LSM-KVS in monolith and disaggregated infrastructure, including encryption key rotation.

Projects.Title: CGroup - Manager
Projects.Description: A Python library to start and monitor a Linux process using cgroups.

Projects.Title: Memories
Projects.Description: A Python library for Image Segmentation.

Projects.Title: Hackathon by SVB & ASU
Projects.Description: Developed a full-stack web application connecting investors and startups. Achieved second place.

questions.question: Imagine you're onboarding a new team member to a complex project involving AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, S3, ECS, SQS, and CloudFormation. What's your primary focus during the initial onboarding process?
options: Diving deep into the technical intricacies of each AWS service used in the project.
Providing a high-level overview of the project's architecture and its components.
Focusing on the practical, hands-on coding aspects, letting them explore the services on their own.
Prioritizing establishing clear communication channels and expectations for their role.

questions.question: During your research on Online Child Sexual Abuse (OCSA), you faced conflicting viewpoints within the team about the best approach to filter instances. How did you navigate this situation?
options: Took charge and made the final decision based on your own understanding of the problem.
Facilitated a discussion to understand everyone's perspective, then guided the team toward a consensus.
Conducted a small pilot study to test each proposed approach and let the data guide the decision.
Deferred to the senior researcher's expertise and implemented their preferred approach.

questions.question: While developing the framework for automating LLM-assisted tuning for LSM-KVS, you discovered a more efficient but less conventional method.  Your supervisor initially prefers the established approach. How do you proceed?
options: Implement the established approach first, then demonstrate the benefits of the new method through comparative analysis.
Respectfully explain the advantages of the new method, supporting it with data and potential risks.
Implement the new method discreetly and present the improved results once it's proven successful.
Defer to your supervisor's judgment and follow their guidance on the established approach.

questions.question: You encountered unexpected performance bottlenecks while leveraging programmable network switches for LSM-KVS operations.  How do you approach debugging and resolving this issue?
questions.basedOn: Leveraging Programmable Network Switch for pre-emptive LSM-KVS Operations
options: Systematically isolate each component and conduct performance tests to pinpoint the bottleneck.
Reach out to online communities and forums for potential solutions encountered by others.
Review the existing codebase thoroughly to identify potential logical errors and inefficiencies.
Focus on optimizing the P4 switch programming first, assuming the bottleneck lies within its logic.

questions.question: Your team placed second in the SVB & ASU hackathon.  Reflecting back, what's one key improvement you would make to the project given more time?
options: Refine the user interface and user experience design for better accessibility and aesthetics.
Implement more advanced features and functionalities to enhance the application's core offering.
Conduct thorough testing and bug fixing to ensure a stable and robust application.
Focus on improving the scalability and performance of the application to handle larger loads.
